Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for storage capacity, performance, and caching needs. Identify the applications and workloads that will use Azure HPC Cache.
Design the cache architecture, including the placement of cache clusters, integration with existing storage solutions, and network topology.
Create and configure the Azure HPC Cache service in the Azure portal. Specify cache size, throughput, and other parameters based on requirements.
Set up caching policies, including data eviction rules, prefetching, and tiering strategies to optimize performance.
Connect Azure HPC Cache to existing storage solutions such as Azure Blob Storage, NFS servers, or other supported storage types.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure access controls and ensure compliance with organizational security policies.
Perform thorough testing of cache performance, including latency, throughput, and failover scenarios to ensure the setup meets requirements.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and other tools to track cache performance, health, and usage metrics.
Document the cache architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the setup.
Ensure the setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
